subject: JPN
name: Beginning Japanese I
info: This course is the first of a two-semester sequence of Beginning Japanese; it is for students who have no previous knowledge of Japanese. It aims to begin the development of communication skills in Japanese from True Beginner to the Novice Mid or Novice High level of the guidelines set by ACTFL. We will work on the four basic skills of language (speaking, listening, reading, and writing) as well as culture-specific skills (do's and don'ts). It is expected that, by the end of this semester, students will have basic conversation skills, as well as rudimentary literacy in Japanese. Two types of Japanese characters (hiragana and katakana), as well as about 60 Chinese characters (kanji) will be learned.

subject: JPN
name: Beginning Japanese II
info:
This course is the second of a two-semester sequence of Beginning Japanese. It aims to begin the development of communication skills in Japanese to the Novice High level of the guidelines set by ACTFL. Therefore, students will continue learning the four skills of language (speaking, listening, reading, and writing) as well as culture-specific skills (dos and don'ts). It is expected that, by the end of this semester, students will be able to talk about family and friends, describe health concerns, and so on. Students also will be able to read and write short paragraphs, such as a letter or a report. To facilitate literacy, students will learn about 90 additional kanji (about 150 in total including those learned in JPN1011).　

prereq: JPN1011 or instr consent

subject: JPN
name: Jpn Calligraphy I
info: Basic tools (e.g., brush, sumi ink stick, rice paper). Practice in basic brush strokes. Different characters or hiragana in expressions that are appropriate for season or that have cultural significance. Taught entirely in Japanese.

subject: JPN
name: JPN Calligraphy II
info: Tools used in Japanese calligraphy (e.g., brush, sumi ink stick, rice paper). Basic brush strokes. Talk about/appreciation of calligraphy. Different characters or hiragana in expressions that are appropriate for season or that have cultural significance. One-to-one feedback on practice calligraphy. Taught entirely in Japanese.

subject: JPN
name: Intermediate Japanese I
info:
This course is the first in a two-semester sequence of Intermediate Japanese. It is for students who have either passed the Beginning Japanese course (JPN1012) or a placement test. If you wish to take the placement test, please contact the instructor. By the end of this course, students are expected to reach the Intermediate Low or Mid level of the guidelines set by ACTFL. We will continue to work on the four main language skills (speaking, listening, reading, and writing), covering grammar topics such as potential form, volitional form, and special verbs for giving and receiving favors. By the end of this semester, students should have smoother conversation skills both in casual and formal speech, as well as intermediate literacy in Japanese, including learning about 80 additional kanji (about 220 including all prerequisite classes’ kanji).

prereq: JPN1012 or instr consent

subject: JPN
name: Intermediate Japanese II
info:
This course is the latter half of a two-semester sequence of Intermediate Japanese. It is for students who have either passed the first half of the Intermediate Japanese course (JPN3021) or a placement test. If you wish to take the placement test, please contact the instructor. By the end of this course, students are expected to reach the Intermediate Mid or High level of the guidelines set by ACTFL. We will cover additional grammar topics such as honorific and humble forms, as well as causative and passive forms. By the end of this semester, students should be able to communicate using casual, formal and honorific speech. About 80 additional kanji (about 300 including all prerequisite classes’ kanji) will be taught.

prereq: JPN3021 or instr consent

subject: JPN
name: Third Year Japanese I
info:
This course is the first half of a two-semester sequence of Third-Year Japanese. The course aims to develop the four communication skills: speaking, listening, reading, and writing, as well as strategies for carrying on a conversation. Based on the guidelines that American Council on the Teaching of Foreign Languages (ALCFL) has made, you will aim to reach the level of Intermediate High by the end of this course. You are expected to spend two to three hours per day outside the classroom at least preparing for class every day. In the University language programs, a grade of C- or better (or S) is required to continue to the next level, JPN 3032/4006, the second half of a two-semester sequence of Third-Year Japanese. Otherwise, students are required to pass a placement test.

prereq: JPN 3022/4004 or Placement Test

subject: JPN
name: Third Year Japanese II
info:
This course is the second half of a two-semester sequence of Third-Year Japanese. The course aims to develop the four communication skills: speaking, listening, reading, and writing, at an intermediate-high level, as well as strategies for carrying on a conversation. Based on the guidelines that American Council on the Teaching of Foreign Languages (ALCFL) has made, you will aim to reach the level of Advanced Low by the end of this course. You are expected to spend two to three hours per day outside the classroom at least preparing for class every day. In the University language programs, a grade of C- or better (or S) is required to continue to the next level, JPN 4041, the first half of a two-semester sequence of Advanced Japanese. Otherwise, students are required to pass a placement test.  

prereq: JPN 3031/4005 or Placement Test

subject: JPN
name: Re-examining Geisha
info: Critically investigates conceptions/representations of Japanese women entertainers, commonly termed "geisha." Literary texts, visual/performing arts, film. Premodern/modern Japanese examples, examples from the United States.

subject: JPN
name: Japanese Teaching Tutorial
info:
Students tutor beginning students of Japanese and are part of department's Japanese language team.

prereq: Grade of A in 4042

subject: JPN
name: Intro to Jpn Ling
info: Analysis of structure and meaning of Japanese sentence patterns.

subject: JPN
name: Directed Studies
info: Directed study in topics of Japanese literature or linguistics.

subject: JPN
name: Beg Japanese I Grad Research

name: Int Japanese II Grad Research
fullname: Intermediate Japanese II for Graduate Student Research
info:

name: Third Yr Japanese II Grad Rsch
fullname: Third Year Japanese II for Graduate Student Research

Meets with 3032

subject: JPN
name: Advanced Japanese I
fullname: Advanced Japanese Conversation and Composition I
info:
This course is designed to refine Japanese composition and conversation skills, empowering students to set their own language proficiency goals beyond classroom boundaries. While the Japanese Language Proficiency Test (JLPT) is one possible objective, students have the flexibility to choose their own milestones based on self-reflection and consultation with the teacher. Emphasis will be on advancing grammar, vocabulary, and authentic communication abilities, preparing students for real-world language use outside of the classroom. The course aims to empower students in their language learning journey by tailoring support to their individual objectives and readiness levels.

prereq: JPN3032 or instr consent

subject: JPN
name: Advanced Japanese II
fullname: Advanced Japanese Conversation and Composition II
info:
Practice in advanced spoken/written Japanese. Typical assignments include essays, summaries, formal interviews in Japanese.

prereq: 4041 or instr consent

subject: JPN
name: Classical Jpn
info: Study of the structures and arguments of classical Japanese poetry, narrative, and drama.

subject: JPN
name: Classical Japanese
info: Analysis of the structures and arguments of classical Japanese poetry, narrative, and drama.

subject: JPN
name: Readings in Japanese Texts
info:
Students read authentic materials of various types to increase reading and speaking ability. Topics specified in Class Schedule.

prereq: 4042 or equiv or instr consent

subject: JPN
name: Reading Japanese Lit & Culture
fullname: Reading Japanese Texts: Literature and Culture
info: This course is conducted 100% in modern Japanese, including course materials, lectures, and discussions. Close reading of texts written in modern Japanese, including a recent novel, essays on social phenomena, critical essays on Japanese society, and/or academic papers. Read and translate these texts accurately and critically; discuss them in Japanese, and/or compose an essay entirely in modern Japanese. Pre-requisite: JPN 4042 or equivalent or instructor consent.

subject: JPN
name: Jpn for Careers
info:
Effective communication using spoken and written Japanese in contexts likely to be encountered by a career-oriented professional in Japan.

prereq: 4041 or 4042 or instr consent

subject: JPN
name: Jpn for Careers
info: Effective communication using spoken and written Japanese in contexts likely to be encountered by a career-oriented professional in Japan.

subject: JPN
name: Topics Jpn Literature
info: Literary, historical, or cultural study of selected Japanese literature.

subject: JPN
name: Premod Wmn's Wrting
info: Works by women in premodern Japan including Genji monogatari, a lengthy narrative, Makura no soshi, a collection of vignettes, and poetry. Concerns include gendered writing system/authorship, narrative techniques, sexuality and the figure of the author, and strategies of fictionality.

subject: JPN
name: Premod Tale Lit
info: Tale literature, both Buddhist and secular, presents the world of the middle- to lower-class people. Rhetoric and religion, fiction and history, gender and sexuality, the role of the supernatural/fantastic, and re-tellings of earlier texts.

subject: JPN
name: Jpn Hist Narratives
info: Narratives rooted in history. Issues include the problematization of reality, the formation of national identity, the idea of divine Imperial power, oral storytelling and its relationship to written texts, and the popularization of historical writings.

subject: JPN
name: Mod J Lit
fullname: Readings in Early Modern Japanese Literature
info: An examination of the stylistic and ideological aspects of the prose fiction, poetry, and non-fiction of the period 1863 to 1945. Offered in a rotating format alternating between readings in the original language and readings in English translation.

subject: JPN
name: Contemp J Lit
fullname: Readings in Postwar and Contemporary Japanese Literature
info: Literary and historical exploration of selected works published between 1945 and the present. Focus may be on a writer, a period, or a theme. Offered in a rotating format alternating between readings in the original language and readings in English translation.

subject: JPN
name: 20 Cent J Wmn's Lit
info: Literary and historical exploration of selected works by Japanese women writers in a variety of genres. All literary texts read in Japanese; critical readings may be in English.

subject: JPN
name: Intro Classical Chinese I
info:
Reading excerpts from canonical Chinese texts. Transnational nature of Classical Chinese/its importance in study of East Asian cultures. Taught in English.

prereq: Two years of an East Asian language (Chinese, Japanese, Korean) or equivalent or instr consent

subject: JPN
name: Intro Classical Chinese II
info:
Reading excerpts from canonical Chinese texts. Transnational nature of Classical Chinese/its importance in study of East Asian cultures. Taught in English.

prereq: 5211 and two years of an East Asian language (Chinese, Japanese, Korean) or equivalent or instr consent

subject: JPN
name: Hist of Jpn Lang
info: Development of Japanese grammar from classical to the modern language.

subject: JPN
name: Jpn Syntax/Semantic
info: Analysis of structure and meaning of Japanese sentence patterns.

subject: JPN
name: Jpn Phonol/Morph
info: Generative and nongenerative approaches to Japanese sound and word structure.

subject: JPN
name: Jpn Discourse/CA
info: Analysis of Japanese written texts and conversations. Emergence of grammar in discourse, discourse/conversational structural units, patterns genre, strategies, style, and sociolinguistics variables.

subject: JPN
name: Prosem: Jpn Ling
info: Selected topics in Japanese linguistics and/or contrastive analysis of Japanese and English with attention to contributions from Eastern and Western linguistic traditions.

subject: JPN
name: Jpn Direct Studies
info:
Individual study with guidance of a faculty member.
Prereq instr consent, dept consent, college consent.

subject: JPN
name: FTE: Master's
info:
(No description)

prereq: Master's student, adviser and DGS consent

subject: JPN
name: FTE: Doctoral
info:
(No description)

prereq: Doctoral student, adviser and DGS consent

subject: JPN
name: Premod Japanese Lit
info: Selected topic in Japanese literature from 8th century to 1860s; theoretical tools used to analyze modern Japanese literature.

subject: JPN
name: Premodern Poetry
info: Presentation of poetry in four genres: imperial anthologies, narratives centered around poetry, personal collections, and noh plays. Implications of anthologizing/collecting, relationships between prose and poetry, and construction of an authorial figure.

subject: JPN
name: Marginalized Lit
info: Texts located at fringes of premodern Japanese literary canon. Ranges from collection of songs sung by women entertainers/prostitutes to texts from Ryukyu islands. Power, canon, and center/margin relationship.

subject: JPN
name: Premod Urban Lit
info: Literature and dramatic scripts between 1600-1868 about urban space and society in regions of Kyoto/Osaka and Edo (Tokyo). Notion of popular culture, relationship between textual production and consumption, and discourses of the urban.

subject: JPN
name: Modern Jpn Lit
info: Selected topic in Japanese literature from 1860s to the present, including analytical styles and strategies used in Japanese literary criticism.

subject: JPN
name: Sem Jpn Linguistics
info: Research on selected topic in Japanese linguistics; emphasizes collecting and analyzing primary data.

subject: JPN
name: Doct Pre-Thesis Cr*
info:
tbd

prereq: Doctoral student who has not passed prelim oral; no required consent for 1st/2nd registrations, up to 12 combined cr; dept consent for 3rd/4th registrations, up to 24 combined cr; doctoral student admitted before summer 2007 may register up to four times, up to 60 combined cr

subject: JPN
name: Thesis Credit:Mast*
info:
(No description)

prereq: Max 18 cr per semester or summer; 10 cr total required (Plan A only)

subject: JPN
name: Thesis Credit:Doct*
info:
(No description)

prereq: Max 18 cr per semester or summer; 24 cr required
